result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelli L. St. Germaine

defendant.name: St. Germaine, Kelli L.
defendant.address: 119 Chippewa South, Lac Du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt:
2:35 PM Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine in court, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Anne M. Katte in court for Kelli L. St. Germaine.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 20CF72, 20CF164, 22CF81 and 22CM6. Victim rights complied with 22CM6. No victim appearing. Defense gave Court the plea questionnaire and a waiver of rights form. Court reads the plea agreement.  Defendant pleads guilty to the four counts listed in plea agreement on the plea questionnaire. Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty in 22CM6 count 1, 20CF72 count 1, count 2 dismissed and read in, 22CF81 count 2 and count 3 as to 20CF164 all counts are dismissed and read in. 
State speaks to sentencing. Attorney Katte speaks to the joint recommendation and requests a minor change by not assessing any additional jail time. Defense requests treatment in lieu of conditional jail time. Defendant makes a statement to the court. Felony advisements given. 

Court imposes - 
22CM06: 90 days jail IMPOSED AND STAYED and one year probation. Consecutive jail sentences. Full restitution paid to victim in the amount of $71.50, payable within 60 days to the Clerk of Court's Office. Probation with AODA and treatment, mental health evaluation and treatment, employment, and other programming as deemed necessary by agent. Probation concurrent.
20CF72: 9 months jail IMPOSED AND STAYED and two years probation. Probation with AODA and treatment, mental health evaluation and treatment, employment, and other programming as deemed necessary by agent.
22CF81: 6 months jail on felony matter, 30 days jail concurrent misdemeanor charge IMPOSED AND STAYED and two years of probation. Court notes credit of 119 days.  Probation with AODA and treatment, mental health evaluation and treatment, employment, and other programming as deemed necessary by agent, 120 conditional jail time STAYED - report to inpatient treatment within 45 days of today.  Review haring in 90 days. If reported as required and successfully completed the 120 days will not have to served. 
20CF164: Court dismisses and read in entire case.

DNA sample is required.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:22 PM Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anne M. Katte appeared by video for Kelli L. St. Germaine.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court hears initial appearance and waiver on22CF81.  Attorney to file motion and have hearing set on bond.  Bond continued.
Status hearing on June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:26 AM Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine in court, in custody.  Attorney Anne M. Katte not in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Katte contacted the court and was unavailable to appear this morning.  Cases are assigned to Judge Klein and attorneys need to contact Judge Klein's Judicial Assistant to schedule hearings.  Bond continued.

1:50 PM Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anne M. Katte not in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Case to be set before Judge Klein.  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status hearing on June 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

11:39 AM Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine in court, in custody without counsel for case 22CF81..  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Katte has not yet been appointed to this case.  Defendant confirms receipt of complaint.  Disqualification to occur in this case.  Application for specific judicial assignment to be completed. Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine appeared by video, in custody.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant and sets bond at $750 Cash.  Bond form.
Status hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Return on warrant on May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant does not appear. Attorney Katte appears by video for the Defendant. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court issues $2,500.00 bench warrant on the non appearance.
Status hearing on April 4, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Defendant appears by video from the Oneida County Jail.  Attorney Svehlek appears by video on behalf of Attorney Katte.  Complaint recieved.  State notes victim has not been consulted with aas of this date.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court sets bond at $2,500 Signature.  Bond form faxed to Oneida County Jail.  Pretrial Conference scheduled March 8, 2022 at 2:30 pm.  Status hearing scheduled March 14, 2022 at 9:00 am.  Defendant advised by court to appear in person for status hearing.
Status hearing on March 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
